title: Quantum Benchmarking Performance Metrics File Schema
description: Describes required fields for a valid performance metrics file.

$schema.title: Schema URI
$schema.desription: A hyperlink to the schema that describes this JSON object.

performance_metrics_uuid.title: Performance Metrics UUID
performance_metrics_uuid.description: The UUID of the performance metrics file as a string in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

creation_timestamp.title: Creation Timestamp
creation_timestamp.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

solver_short_name.title: Short name of the solver.
solver_short_name.description: A short string for human readability that is not necessarily unique.  E.g., `DMRG_32core_64GB`

solver_uuid.title: The UUID of the solver.
solver_uuid.description: The UUID of the solver as a string in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

ml_metrics_calculator_version.title: ML performance metrics calculator version
ml_metrics_calculator_version.description: The version of the ML metrics calculator software.

solvability_ratio.title: ML Solvability Ratio
solvability_ratio.description: TODO.  A number between 0-1.  A higher number is better.

f1_score.title: F1 score
f1_score.description: TODO.  This is a measure of the goodness of the ML model, not the solver being evaluated.

top_level_results.title: Results
top_level_results.description: Aggregated performance metrics and ML scores.

number_of_problem_instances.title: Number of problem instances available.
number_of_problem_instances.description: A count of the number of `problem_instances` currently available (at creation time of this file) in the `problem_instances` directory.

number_of_problem_instances_attempted.title: Number of problem instances attempted
number_of_problem_instances_attempted.description: A count of the number of `problem_instances` where a solution was provided for at least one Hamiltonian (task) in the `problem_instance`

number_of_problem_instances_solved.title: Number of problem instances solved
number_of_problem_instances_solved.description: A count of the number of `problem_instances` where the solutions for *all* Hamiltonians (tasks) were within the run time and accuracy requirements.

number_of_tasks.title: Number of Hamiltonians (tasks) available.
number_of_tasks.description: A count of the number of Hamiltonians (tasks) currently available (at creation time of this file) required in each `problem_instance` file.

number_of_tasks_attempted.title: Number of Hamiltonians (tasks) attempted.
number_of_tasks_attempted.description: A count of the number of Hamiltonians (tasks) where a solution was provided.

number_of_tasks_solved_within_run_time_l.title: Number of Hamiltonians (tasks) solved within run time limit.
number_of_tasks_solved_within_run_time_l.description: A count of the number of Hamiltonians (tasks) where a solution was provided that was within the run time limit.

number_of_tasks_solved_within_accuracy_t.title: Number of Hamiltonians (tasks) solved within accuracy threshold.
number_of_tasks_solved_within_accuracy_t.description: A count of the number of Hamiltonians (tasks) where a solution was provided that was within the accuracy threshold.

number_of_tasks_solved.title: Number of Hamiltonians (tasks) solved to requirements.
number_of_tasks_solved.description: A count of the number of Hamiltonians (tasks) where a solution was provided met requirements.

max_run_time_of_attempted_tasks.title: Max run time of attempted Hamiltonians (tasks).
max_run_time_of_attempted_tasks.description: The maximum run time of the solutions provided for all attempted Hamiltonians (tasks).  In seconds.

sum_of_run_time_of_attempted_tasks.title: The sum of the run time of attempted Hamiltonians (tasks).
sum_of_run_time_of_attempted_tasks.description: The sum of the run time of the solutions provided for all attempted Hamiltonians (tasks).  In seconds.

results_by_problem_instance.title: Results aggregated by problem instance
results_by_problem_instance.description: Performance metrics are aggregated to the `problem_instance` level.

problem_instance_uuid.title: Problem instance UUID
problem_instance_uuid.description: The UUID of the starting `problem_instance`.  A string in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

solution_uuid.title: Solution file UUID
solution_uuid.description: The UUID of the solution JSON submitted by a performer/solver to solve the associated `problem_instance`.  A string in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

number_of_tasks_solved.description: TODO DESCRIPTION solved within run time limit and accuracy threshold.

solution_submitted_by_due_date.title: Solution Within Due Date?
solution_submitted_by_due_date.description: Each `problem_instance` file has a specified calendar due date.  This boolean to identifies if the solution was submitted by the due date.  If there was no due date specified, then this is `true`.

results_by_task.title: TODO
results_by_task.description: A list of objects, one for each Hamiltonian (by `task_uuid`)

task_uuid.title: Task UUID
task_uuid.description: UUID for the task from the list of tasks in the `problem_instance` file in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

problem_instance_uuid.title: Problem instance UUID
problem_instance_uuid.description: The UUID of the starting `problem_instance`.  A string in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

instance_data_object_uuid.title: Instance Data Object UUID
instance_data_object_uuid.description: UUID for the data object (typically a Hamiltonian in FCIDUMP format) in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

attempted.title: TODO
attempted.description: a boolean indicating if the solver attempted to calculate the GSE for the Hamiltonian.  At this time, if the data is missing from `solution.json` files, it is considered NOT attempted and other metrics indicate failure.

solved_within_run_time.title: TODO
solved_within_run_time.description: a boolean indicating if the solver run time was within the run time requirement specified in the problem_instance.

solved_within_accuracy_requirement.title: TODO
solved_within_accuracy_requirement.description: a boolean indicating if the solver run time was within the accuracy requirement specified in the problem_instance.
